ARABIC: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُۥ وَمَا كَسَبَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: His wealth has not helped him nor anything he has earned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Of no avail shall be his wealth, nor what he has acquired.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: His wealth did not avail him, nor his acquisitions.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: His wealth did not benefit him in the least, nor did whatever he earned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: His wealth and his children will not benefit him!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: His wealth and what he earns will not avail him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: His wealth avails him not, neither what he has earned;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: His wealth and gains will not exempt him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Neither his wealth nor his gains will avail him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: His substance availed him not, nor that which he earned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Neither his wealth availed him, nor what he had earned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: No profit to him from all his wealth, and all his gains!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: His wealth and his children (etc.) will not benefit him!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: His wealth will not suffice him, neither what he has gained;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: His wealth did not avail him, nor did what he acquired.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: His wealth will not avail him or that which he gained.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [111:2] His wealth will not avail him, nor what he has earned (wa-kasab means wa-kasbihi, that is to say, his sons; mā aghnā means [mā] yughnī).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (His wealth) his abundant wealth (and gains) many children (will not exempt him) in the Hereafter.
